verses.verse: The proverbs<WH4912> of Solomon<WH8010>. A wise<WH2450> son<WH1121> maketh a glad<WH8055> father<WH1>: but a foolish<WH3684> son<WH1121> is the heaviness<WH8424> of his mother<WH517>.
Treasures<WH214> of wickedness<WH7562> profit<WH3276> nothing: but righteousness<WH6666> delivereth<WH5337> from death<WH4194>.

The LORD<WH3068> will not suffer<WH7456> the soul<WH5315> of the righteous<WH6662> to famish<WH7456>: but he casteth away<WH1920> the substance<WH1942> of the wicked<WH7563>. the substance: or, the wicked for their wickedness
He becometh poor<WH7326> that dealeth<WH6213> with a slack<WH7423> hand<WH3709>: but the hand<WH3027> of the diligent<WH2742> maketh rich<WH6238>.
He that gathereth<WH103> in summer<WH7019> is a wise<WH7919> son<WH1121>: but he that sleepeth<WH7290> in harvest<WH7105> is a son<WH1121> that causeth shame<WH954>.
Blessings<WH1293> are upon the head<WH7218> of the just<WH6662>: but violence<WH2555> covereth<WH3680> the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563>.
The memory<WH2143> of the just<WH6662> is blessed<WH1293>: but the name<WH8034> of the wicked<WH7563> shall rot<WH7537>.
The wise<WH2450> in heart<WH3820> will receive<WH3947> commandments<WH4687>: but a prating<WH8193> fool<WH191> shall fall<WH3832>. a prating: Heb. a fool of lips fall: Heb. be beaten
He that walketh<WH3212> uprightly<WH8537> walketh<WH1980> surely<WH983>: but he that perverteth<WH6140> his ways<WH1870> shall be known<WH3045>.
He that winketh<WH7169> with the eye<WH5869> causeth<WH5414> sorrow<WH6094>: but a prating<WH8193> fool<WH191> shall fall<WH3832>. fall: Heb. be beaten
The mouth<WH6310> of a righteous<WH6662> man is a well<WH4726> of life<WH2416>: but violence<WH2555> covereth<WH3680> the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563>.
Hatred<WH8135> stirreth up<WH5782> strifes<WH4090>: but love<WH160> covereth<WH3680> all sins<WH6588>.

In the lips<WH8193> of him that hath understanding<WH995> wisdom<WH2451> is found<WH4672>: but a rod<WH7626> is for the back<WH1460> of him that is void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820>. of understanding: Heb. of heart
Wise<WH2450> men lay up<WH6845> knowledge<WH1847>: but the mouth<WH6310> of the foolish<WH191> is near<WH7138> destruction<WH4288>.
The rich man's<WH6223> wealth<WH1952> is his strong<WH5797> city<WH7151>: the destruction<WH4288> of the poor<WH1800> is their poverty<WH7389>.
The labour<WH6468> of the righteous<WH6662> tendeth to life<WH2416>: the fruit<WH8393> of the wicked<WH7563> to sin<WH2403>.
He is in the way<WH734> of life<WH2416> that keepeth<WH8104> instruction<WH4148>: but he that refuseth<WH5800> reproof<WH8433> erreth<WH8582>. erreth: or, causeth to err
He that hideth<WH3680> hatred<WH8135> with lying<WH8267> lips<WH8193>, and he that uttereth<WH3318> a slander<WH1681>, is a fool<WH3684>.
In the multitude<WH7230> of words<WH1697> there wanteth<WH2308> not sin<WH6588>: but he that refraineth<WH2820> his lips<WH8193> is wise<WH7919>.
The tongue<WH3956> of the just<WH6662> is as choice<WH977> silver<WH3701>: the heart<WH3820> of the wicked<WH7563> is little worth<WH4592>.
The lips<WH8193> of the righteous<WH6662> feed<WH7462> many<WH7227>: but fools<WH191> die<WH4191> for want<WH2638> of wisdom<WH3820>. of wisdom: Heb. of heart
The blessing<WH1293> of the LORD<WH3068>, it maketh rich<WH6238>, and he addeth<WH3254> no sorrow<WH6089> with it.
It is as sport<WH7814> to a fool<WH3684> to do<WH6213> mischief<WH2154>: but a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> hath wisdom<WH2451>.
The fear<WH4034> of the wicked<WH7563>, it shall come<WH935> upon him: but the desire<WH8378> of the righteous<WH6662> shall be granted<WH5414>.
As the whirlwind<WH5492> passeth<WH5674>, so is the wicked<WH7563> no more: but the righteous<WH6662> is an everlasting<WH5769> foundation<WH3247>.
As vinegar<WH2558> to the teeth<WH8127>, and as smoke<WH6227> to the eyes<WH5869>, so is the sluggard<WH6102> to them that send<WH7971> him.
The fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> prolongeth<WH3254> days<WH3117>: but the years<WH8141> of the wicked<WH7563> shall be shortened<WH7114>. prolongeth: Heb. addeth
The hope<WH8431> of the righteous<WH6662> shall be gladness<WH8057>: but the expectation<WH8615> of the wicked<WH7563> shall perish<WH6>.
The way<WH1870> of the LORD<WH3068> is strength<WH4581> to the upright<WH8537>: but destruction<WH4288> shall be to the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>.
The righteous<WH6662> shall never<WH5769> be removed<WH4131>: but the wicked<WH7563> shall not inhabit<WH7931> the earth<WH776>.
The mouth<WH6310> of the just<WH6662> bringeth forth<WH5107> wisdom<WH2451>: but the froward<WH8419> tongue<WH3956> shall be cut out<WH3772>.
The lips<WH8193> of the righteous<WH6662> know<WH3045> what is acceptable<WH7522>: but the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563> speaketh frowardness<WH8419>. frowardness: Heb. frowardnesses
